In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution:
```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$current_line\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    
    return result * current_line
end

# Example usage:
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nam ac varius nulla. Donec et erat non dui sollicitudin condimentum."
println(wrap_string(s))
```
In this function, it splits the string into words using `split` function, then iterates over each word. If adding a new word to current line would exceed the maximum width (`length(current_line * " $word") > text_width`), it appends a new line to result and starts a new current line with this word. Otherwise, it just adds the word to the end of current line. In the end, it returns the final line (which might not have been added if it exceeded width).
